title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Horace Neide to J. M. Schofield, August 20, 1866
summary: Neide submits an inspection report of the 7th and 8th Districts. At this time, Augusta County was a part of the 7th District, and such portions of Neide's report are transcribed here. His remarks concern the ability of blacks to find justice in the local courts, the registration of marriages, and the general abilities of George Cook, the agent.
keywords: Administration/Bureaucracy, Employment/Labor, Legal System, Race Relations, Slavery, Violence/Crime, Women, American Civil War
